item.title: 公众羞辱如何帮助创建一个有前途的美国住房计划
item.description:
哈佛大学的一项研究促使夏洛特市为首次购房者提供更多支持，以此推动社会流动。【原文：

A Harvard study spurred Charlotte to give more support to first-time homebuyers as a way to drive social mobility.

item.title: 市场期待就业数据重振骤降的国债涨势
item.description: 债券投资者对周五就业报告中任何美国经济疲软的迹象都保持警惕，因为他们要评估近期国债的涨势是否还有进一步的空间。【原文：Bond investors are on alert for any signs of US economic weakness in Friday’s employment report, as they assess whether the recent rally in Treasuries has further room to run.】

item.title: 美股受关税困惑影响在关键水平附近徘徊
item.description: 对美国股市来说，本周可谓是旋风式的一周，因为关税达到了白热化的程度，使 S&P 500 指数跌入谷底，并短暂跌破了密切关注的技术水平。【原文：It’s been a whirlwind of a week for US stocks as tariffs hit a fever pitch, sending the S&P 500 into a tailspin that briefly drove it below a closely watched technical level.】

item.title: 据说日本生命将考虑收购印度印度银行的股份
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，日本生命保险公司印度分公司正在考虑收购印度印度银行有限公司（IndusInd Bank Ltd.）的少数股份，目的是利用该银行的网络扩大其保险产品的销售。【原文：Nippon Life Insurance Co.’s India unit is considering buying a minority stake in IndusInd Bank Ltd., people familiar with the matter said, with the aim of using the lender’s network to expand sales of its insurance products.】

item.title: 印度任命科尔尼公司的考沙尔为 HPCL 董事长兼总经理
item.description: 根据彭博新闻社看到的一份政府声明，印度政府已选择管理咨询公司科尔尼的印度高管维卡思-考沙尔（Vikas Kaushal）领导国营炼油企业印度斯坦石油公司（Hindustan Petroleum Corp Ltd.）。【原文：India’s government has picked management consulting firm Kearney’s India executive Vikas Kaushal to lead state-run refiner Hindustan Petroleum Corp Ltd., according to a government statement seen by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 欧盟领导人呼吁在斯洛伐克推动下解决乌克兰天然气问题
item.description: 欧盟领导人呼吁加紧努力解决乌克兰天然气过境问题，这对斯洛伐克总理罗伯特-菲佐来说是一个胜利，他曾威胁说如果不解决这一问题，将否决集团紧急峰会的结论。【原文：European Union leaders called for stepping up efforts to resolve the Ukraine gas transit issue, a win for Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico, who had threatened to veto conclusions of the bloc’s emergency summit if the matter wasn’t addressed.】

item.title: 2024 年底欧元区经济增长超过预期
item.description: 受消费者支出和企业投资的推动，欧元区去年年底的经济增长超过了最初的估计。【原文：The euro-area economy grew more than initially estimated at the end of last year, bolstered by consumer spending and business investments.】

item.title: 中国茶叶企业奈雪派克因消费者谨慎消费而蒙受损失
item.description: 茶叶连锁店奈雪控股有限公司（Nayuki Holdings Ltd.）表示，由于中国消费者担心未来的不确定性而减少消费，该公司预计今年将出现亏损。【原文：Tea chain Nayuki Holdings Ltd. said it expects to post a loss for the year as Chinese costumers rein in spending, fearing uncertainty ahead.】

item.title: 比利时埃利亚公司凭借电网计划资金创下历史最高飙升纪录
item.description: 比利时电网公司埃利亚集团（Elia Group）的股价飙升至历史最高水平，因为该公司确定了为大规模扩建国内和德国输电网络提供资金的计划。【原文：Shares in Belgian power grid company Elia Group soared the most on record as it firmed up plans for funding a massive expansion of transmission networks at home and in Germany.】

item.title: 美国银行上调预测，欧元将迎来 2009 年以来最好的一周
item.description: 在德国历史性地承诺增加国防和基础设施开支后，欧元将创下 16 年来最好的单周表现。【原文：The euro is set for its best weekly performance in 16 years after Germany’s historic pledge to ramp up spending for defense and infrastructure.】

item.title: 石油巨头在卡沙甘争端中获得有利仲裁裁决
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，在与哈萨克斯坦政府就环境罚款和税收索赔问题发生的数十亿美元纠纷中，经营卡沙干巨型油田的石油巨头获得了两项有利的仲裁裁决。【原文：Oil majors operating the giant Kashagan oil field received a pair of favorable arbitration rulings in multibillion-dollar disputes with Kazakhstan’s government over environmental fine and tax claims, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 印度要求最富有板球联赛禁用酒类和烟草品牌
item.description: 印度卫生部希望禁止在世界上最赚钱的板球比赛中推广烟酒品牌，以遏制罪恶商品制造商日益增长的影响力，而此时距离本赛季第一场比赛仅有三周时间。【原文：India’s health ministry wants to ban promotion of tobacco and alcohol brands in the world’s most lucrative cricket tournament to curb the growing influence of sin goods makers, barely three weeks before the first match of this season.】

item.title: DNO 同意收购 Sval 公司，将产量重心从伊拉克转向挪威
item.description: 挪威国家石油公司（DNO ASA）同意以4.5亿美元的价格从私募股权公司HitecVision手中收购Sval Energi Group AS的全部股份，以扩大其在挪威的业务。【原文：DNO ASA agreed to buy all the shares of Sval Energi Group AS for $450 million from private equity firm HitecVision, as the oil and gas company expands its operations in Norway.】

item.title: 里夫斯告诉金沙国际娱乐网址经济学家她将限制政府开支
item.description: 在全球债券和政府借贷成本剧烈波动的背景下，英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）周四会见了金边债券市场的一级交易商公司，拉开了一年两次的新系列会议的序幕。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves met primary dealer firms in the gilt market on Thursday, kicking off a new series of twice-yearly meetings amid intense volatility in global bonds and government borrowing costs.】

item.title: 关税紧张局势下日本将派贸易大臣武藤访美
item.description: 日本贸易大臣武藤洋治将于下周访问美国，因为东京正加紧努力，寻求从唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税运动中获得缓和。【原文：Japan’s Trade Minister Yoji Muto will visit the US next week as Tokyo steps up efforts to seek a reprieve from President Donald Trump’s tariff campaign.】

item.title: 维斯塔斯支持的初创公司计划建造高耸的木制风力涡轮机塔
item.description: 瑞典 Modvion AB 公司将下一代风力涡轮机塔架的目标定得更高，因为该行业对更大结构的偏好没有放缓的迹象。【原文：Sweden’s Modvion AB has set its sights even higher for its next generation of wind-turbine towers as the industry’s preference for bigger structures shows no sign of slowing down.】

item.title: 欧佩克+放松产量限制，阿美石油公司下调亚洲油价
item.description: 随着欧佩克+组织开始放松对石油生产的限制，沙特阿拉伯正在降低面向其最大市场亚洲买家的石油价格。【原文：Saudi Arabia is cutting oil prices for buyers in Asia, its largest market, as OPEC+ begins to ease restrictions on production.】

item.title: 据说日本央行倾向于在 3 月会议上维持关键利率不变
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，日本央行官员在 1 月份加息后倾向于在本月维持利率不变，因为全球经济日益增长的不确定性需要密切关注。【原文：Bank of Japan officials are leaning toward keeping interest rates unchanged this month after their hike in January and as growing uncertainties in the global economy require close attention, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国施压要求尽快停战，欧洲天然气跌至五个月低点
item.description: 欧洲天然气价格继续大幅下跌，跌至 9 月下旬以来的最低水平，原因是美国要求在与乌克兰达成矿产协议的同时迅速实现停火。【原文：European natural gas prices extended their dramatic decline, tumbling to the lowest level since late September as the US presses for a quick ceasefire to accompany a minerals deal with Ukraine.】

item.title: 关税忧虑引发欧洲股市大面积回落
item.description: 欧洲股市周五回落，原因是迅速演变的关税背景和利率的不确定性促使投资者锁定利润。【原文：European equities retreated on Friday as the quickly-evolving tariff backdrop and uncertainty over interest rates prompted investors to lock in profits.】

item.title: 中国立法者主张加强保密以规避美国芯片禁令
item.description: 一名隶属于当地一家顶级芯片公司的中国立法者要求中国政府允许国家支持的公司对其外国供应商的身份保密，而此时华盛顿正越来越多地阻止中国获得西方的硬件和半导体。【原文：A Chinese lawmaker affiliated with a top local chip firm asked Beijing to let state-backed firms keep the identity of their foreign suppliers a secret, at a time Washington is increasingly blocking the country’s access to Western hardware and semiconductors.】

item.title: 中国央行连续第四个月购买黄金，黄金价格创下历史新高
item.description: 随着贵金属涨至历史新高，中国央行在 2 月份连续第四个月扩大了黄金储备。【原文：China’s central bank expanded its gold reserves for a fourth month in February, as the precious metal rallied to record high.】

item.title: 德国债券趋于稳定，1990 年以来最糟糕的一周即将结束
item.description: 由于投资者暂停评估德国统一以来最糟糕的一周，德国债券周五趋于稳定。【原文：German bonds stabilized on Friday as investors paused to assess what’s set to be their worst week since the nation’s reunification.】

item.title: 菲律宾调查数百名被指控的中国间谍网络
item.description: 一位高级官员说，菲律宾当局发现了一个由数百名被指控的中国间谍组成的网络，这次行动比之前披露的要广泛得多，加剧了两国之间的紧张关系。【原文：Philippine authorities have uncovered a network of hundreds of alleged Chinese spies, a senior official said, a much more extensive operation than previously disclosed that adds to tensions between the countries.】
